main_definition: Chose is the past tense of the verb 'choose', which means to select or pick out something from a number of possibilities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make a decision when faced with two or more options
meanings_and_examples.example: She chose the red dress for the party.

meanings_and_examples.definition: When used in archaic language, it can mean to designate someone as an object of affection or attention
meanings_and_examples.example: In old literature, 'chose' might be used when a suitor declares their love by saying, 'I chose thee.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: To select something from among several options as being the preferred one
meanings_and_examples.example: The committee chose to implement new policies after reviewing all proposals.
